alternative_parents.description: Amino acids in which the amino group is attached to the carbon atom immediately adjacent to the carboxylate group (alpha carbon), or a derivative thereof.
alternative_parents.name: Alpha amino acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a pyridine ring bearing a carboxylic acid group.
alternative_parents.name: Pyridinecarboxylic acids

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carboxylic acid chain (of at least 2 carbon atoms) linked to an imidazole ring.
alternative_parents.name: Imidazolyl carboxylic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an imidazolinone moiety, which is an imidazoline ring bearing a ketone.
alternative_parents.name: Imidazolinones

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds containing one or more benzene rings.
alternative_parents.name: Benzenoids

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an aromatic ring where a carbon atom is linked to an hetero atom.
alternative_parents.name: Heteroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic 1,3-dipolar compounds with the general structure  X#N+-Z- <-> X-=N+=Z <-> X-=N-Z+ <-> X-N=Z (X = C or O, Z = C, N, or O).
alternative_parents.name: Propargyl-type 1,3-dipolar organic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acids containing exactly one carboxyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Monocarboxylic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a carboxylic acid group with the formula -C(=O)OH.
alternative_parents.name: Carboxylic acids

alternative_parents.description: Organonitrogen compounds with the general formula RN=CN(R')(R''), (R,R',R'' = H or organyl group).
alternative_parents.name: Carboximidamides

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acid derivatives containing the amidine group.
alternative_parents.name: Carboxamidines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

class.description: Compounds containing a quinoline moiety, which consists of a benzene ring fused to a pyrimidine ring to form benzo[b]azabenzene.
class.name: Quinolines and derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as quinoline carboxylic acids. These are quinolines in which the quinoline ring system is substituted by a carboxyl group at one or more positions.

direct_parent.description: Quinolines in which the quinoline ring system is substituted by a carboxyl group at one or more positions.
direct_parent.name: Quinoline carboxylic acids

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Quinolines in which the quinoline ring system is substituted by a carboxyl group at one or more positions.
subclass.name: Quinoline carboxylic acids

superclass.description: Compounds containing a ring with least one carbon atom and one non-carbon atom.
superclass.name: Organoheterocyclic compounds
